page.title: 10Public Houses,Bromley,S.E.
page.content: The Bull's Head pub is over 400 Years old and was used by the drivers of the Old London to Dover Road before Pole Hill was cut.There is a story that Dick Turpin used the tunnel that went from Pear Tree Cottage,where he was supposed to have stayed,to the Bull's Head. The tunnel is now blocked off because a house has been built on top. The Buff Orpington pub was so named after a breed of chicken developed by William Cook. He started life as a coach man,and bred chickens at Tower House, Orpington. In 1886 the first Orpington chicken, know as the black Orpington,was produced from a langsham variety.
